alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Greene; Oconee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 05 at 4:36AM EST until January 07 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Clarke, Greene and Oconee Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into fields...woodlands and pastures near the river. The water level is very close to Ward Road on the right bank. Flood waters will be approaching irrigation systems and they may need to be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EST Thursday was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
